meanings.definition: The amount of work done or the number of items produced by a system in a given period of time.
meanings.sent1: The throughputs of the factory increased after implementing new machinery.
meanings.sent2: The throughputs of the bakery determine its efficiency in making bread.
meanings.sent3: The throughputs of the toy assembly line were so high that the robots had to work overtime.
meanings.sent4: Her throughputs in completing puzzles were like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The throughputs of the student in solving math problems were impressive.

meanings.definition: The rate at which data is processed or transferred through a computer or communication system.
meanings.sent1: The throughputs of the internet connection affect the speed of downloading files.
meanings.sent2: The throughputs of the server determine how quickly information can be accessed.
meanings.sent3: The throughputs of the email system were so slow that messages took hours to send.
meanings.sent4: His throughputs in coding were as fast as lightning, impressing his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The throughputs of the printer were so high that it finished printing in seconds.
